summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report of a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional guard from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, conducted on September 25, 2019. The guard details his activities and observations on August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died, including moving Epstein, conducting rounds, and dealing with another inmate's suicide threat. The report notes inconsistencies in the guard's statements.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The guard describes moving him, his demeanor, and a phone call he made on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: A fellow guard mentioned as being present during Epstein's phone call and responsible for filling out 30-minute round paperwork on the night of August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Omer Ramey
persons.context: The FBI agent who drafted the FD-302 report on December 18, 2019, based on the September 25, 2019 interview.

connections.description: Noel was a correctional guard responsible for monitoring Epstein and filling out paperwork related to his rounds on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Activities and Death in Custody
events.description: The guard details his shift, moving Epstein back to his cell around 9:30 PM after another inmate's suicide threat, conducting a final round where Epstein gave a 'thumbs up', and leaving Epstein under the watch of guards Noel and another.

events.title: FBI/OIG Interview of BOP Guard
events.description: The FBI and Office of the Inspector General interview a BOP guard from the MCC's Special Housing Unit about his activities and observations on August 9, 2019. The interview notes inconsistencies in his answers.

events.title: Epstein's Phone Call
events.description: The guard states he facilitated a phone call for Epstein from the G-tier around 8 PM, dialing the number for him. He did not overhear the conversation and left before it ended.

events.title: Other Inmate's Suicide Threat
events.description: Another inmate in the SHU threatened suicide, diverting guards' attention from monitoring Epstein.

keyFacts: A BOP guard was interviewed about his activities on August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died.
The guard stated he moved Epstein back to his cell around 9:30 PM and, during a final round, Epstein gave a 'thumbs up' when asked if he was 'good'.
The guard reported facilitating a phone call for Epstein around 8 PM but did not overhear the conversation.
The interview revealed inconsistencies in the guard's statements, particularly regarding rounds and paperwork procedures.
The guard indicated that another inmate's suicide threat diverted guard attention from Epstein that evening.
